docs.snippet: When the World Cup begins next month, many of the $1.4 billion-worth of projects in Cuiabá, one of the 12 Brazilian host cities, will be far from completion....
docs.lead_paragraph: When the World Cup begins next month, many of the $1.4 billion-worth of projects in Cuiabá, one of the 12 Brazilian host cities, will be far from completion.
docs.abstract: Cuiaba Journal; city of Cuiaba, Brazil, will likely still look like a work in progress by the time the World Cup begins in June 2014; many Brazilians were surprised that the city was chosen as one of the 12 host cities, and at the $1.4 billion invested in Cuiaba to overhaul its antiquated infrastructure.

headline.main: To Prepare for the World Cup, a Host City Could Use Extra Time
headline.print_headline: To Prepare for the World Cup, a Host City Could Use Extra Time

docs.snippet: There is a growing feeling that FIFA and the Olympic committee are taking the parent act a bit too far....
docs.lead_paragraph: There is a growing feeling that FIFA and the Olympic committee are taking the parent act a bit too far.
docs.abstract: Vanessa Barbara Op-Ed article challenges notion that Brazil is too far behind in its preparations for the World Cup and 2016 Olympic Games; says country has grown sick of foreign micromanagement; argues that delays are part of nation's bureaucracy and culture, and that if FIFA and the Olympic committee had wanted punctuality, they should have looked elsewhere.

headline.main: Brazil Is Tired of Being Scolded
headline.print_headline: Brazil Is Tired of Being Scolded

docs.snippet: UEFA has been ordered to pay six-figure damages to a Croatian referee who claimed he had been wrongfully accused of rigging the result of the 2009 Croatian Cup final, state news agency Hina reported on Tuesday....
